intro: Lychnophora damazioi, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in undergrowth of tropical forests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
